title: Challenge-Based Biomechanics Learning: Competency Development Program for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic concepts of exercise mechanics and foundational teaching methodologies
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment focusing on experimental and analytical activities using digital devices. Teachers learn biomechanical principles applicable to real classrooms through challenge-based tasks

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain at least three biomechanical principles of physical movement.
Learners are assessed on their ability to translate biomechanical knowledge into real-world educational scenarios through challenge-based problem-solving (achievement rate over 70%).
Learners develop and present biomechanics education activity designs based on peer feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
